---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
coauthor : @jjaassoonn 
[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [75f3074fc5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17789/commits/75f3074fc5c7d252ceef0482c2f8f975ab40ee45)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +2.22% | `Mathlib.Algebra.Central.Basic` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Central.Basic | 902 | 922 | +20 (+2.22%) |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Basis | 878 | 879 | +1 (+0.11%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Basis`|1|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Central.Basic`|20|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ MatrixRing.isCentral`
`+ TensorProduct.eq_repr_basis_left`
`+ TensorProduct.eq_repr_basis_right`
`+ TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_left_eq_zero`
`+ TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_right_eq_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This docstring is in some sense worse than no docstring, you can get more information by just reading the statement of the theorem.

All the previous results were in a section and used completely different variables. The point of sections is to control the scope of variables. Probably you should have let the section end here and started a new one if you had no interest in the variables already set up. Note also that all your lemmas have variables `{ŒπC ŒπB: Type*} (ùíû : Basis ŒπC K C) (‚Ñ¨ : Basis ŒπB K B)` so perhaps they should also be variables in your new section.

This statement looks quite weird. The assumption that B has a basis is not used in the statement and is not necessary in the proof; indeed all that one needs is that iC spans C as a K-vector space. Then one can write x=sum_i b_i (x) c_i, one writes each c_i in terms of the spanning set and tidies up. No hypotheses on B are necessary at all. It also feels like the most natural statement would be with a finsupp ŒπC ‚Üí_0 B.

K is commutative so surely you can just deduce this from the previous lemma via [`Algebra.TensorProduct.comm`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TensorProduct/Basic.html#Algebra.TensorProduct.comm) rather than going through the long proof again.

This is probably more nicely expressed as a map from finsupp being injective. In fact it seems to just be the statement that if ŒπC is K-linearly independent in C then it's B-linearly independent in B (x) C when B is free. It feels like this should be true more generally. What's the correct statement here?

pullRequest.title: More on central simple
